title: Terms out for PropertyGuru IPO; up to $380.2m raise
text:
Online property classifieds business PropertyGuru will seek to raise up to $380.2 million for its initial public offering and ASX-listing.

According to terms sent to funds on Monday, PropertyGuru is seeking buyers for 84.5 million to 93.3 million securities at $3.70 to $4.50 each.

The price represented 9 to 10.9 times forecast revenue for the 2020 calendar year.

The deal valued PropertyGuru at $1 billion to $1.22 billion on an enterprise value basis and would see its trading on the ASX with a market capitalisation worth $1.16 billion to $1.36 billion.

Securities sold at the IPO would represent a 30.1 per cent to 32.2 per cent stake in the company, the term sheet said. The deal was structured as a sale of CDIs with one CDI equivalent to one share.

Brokers Credit Suisse and UBS will seek to price the deal at a bookbuild on October 22 and 23.
description: Online property classifieds business PropertyGuru will seek to raise up to $380.2 million for its initial public offering and ASX-listing.
